Detailed Description

Interface of asynchronous mutex.

Definition in file sysMutex.h.

Define Documentation

#define CREATE_MUTEX (   mutex)    DECLARE_QUEUE(mutex)

The mutex is similar to binary semaphore with one significant difference: the mutex has an owner. It means that a module (a component) locks a mutex only it can unlock it. If a module tries to unlock a mutex it hasn’t locked (thus doesn’t own) then an error condition is encountered and, most importantly, the mutex is not unlocked. Memory allocation for global mutex. This mutex can be locked by any stack layers and application.

Definition at line 38 of file sysMutex.h.

#define DECLARE_MUTEX (   mutex)    extern SYS_Mutex_t mutex

Declare the global mutex. The mutex must be created in another place.

Definition at line 40 of file sysMutex.h.

typedef QueueDescriptor_t SYS_Mutex_t

Mutex type. It's a kind of queue to order incoming lock requests.
